title: Interview with His Excellency Nicolai Astrup, Minister of International Development of Norway â€“ International Diplomat Global

organizations.name: Telenor
quotes: Telenor (the Norwegian Telecommunications Company) told me that on broadband coverage in Myanmar, they have achieved in 5 years what it took them 20 years to develop in Norway.

organizations.name: University of Oslo
quotes: A good example is a health information system with corresponding software, developed by the University of Oslo.

organizations.name: World Bank
quotes: In many cases, they do not have the capacity or resources to develop their own system, but here they can take something already existing and adopt it to their local needs. This is happening in India, where with the assistance of the World Bank, they will export their system to Morocco.

organizations.name: UNICEF Venture
quotes: To arrive at this stage, we have in addition challenged UNICEF Venture, to set up a prototype of a digital public goods platform.

organizations.name: UN
quotes: We hope that the Panel will also consider it as their priority because the UN system by and large is a platform for independence.

India has built an ICT system for their population of 1.2 billion.
This is happening in India, where with the assistance of the World Bank, they will export their system to Morocco.
China, the U.S. and India have their own approaches on how the digital future will be, so this can be a common denominator platform, which will have a tremendous potential.
